title: React Portfolio
shortDescription: Data-driven React + Vite portfolio with routed pages, filters, and JSON-sourced content.
fullDescription: Modern portfolio site built with Vite and React Router, driven entirely by a JSON data layer so projects can be edited without touching components. Includes responsive layouts, tag/category filters, search, and highlighted projects on the home page.
problem: Keeping a portfolio updated required code changes and lacked structured metadata for filtering.
solution: Centralized project data in JSON with reusable cards and detail pages; added search, tags, and categories to help viewers find relevant work quickly.
architecture: Vite + React + React Router front end; JSON data source; custom hooks for filtering, search, and sorting; responsive layout with shared theme tokens.
challenges: Designing components that stay readable across screen sizes; keeping filters intuitive on mobile; ensuring data changes flow through without rebuilds.
results: Content updates happen in minutes with no component edits; recruiters can filter by tags and categories; highlighted projects surface automatically on the home page.

title: Algorithm Visualizer
shortDescription: Interactive web platform for visualizing algorithms across sorting, pathfinding, graph, data structures, and machine learning.
fullDescription: Comprehensive algorithm visualization platform built with React and TypeScript that brings complex algorithms to life through step-by-step animations. Features 5 main categories with 20+ algorithms including sorting algorithms, pathfinding algorithms, graph algorithms, data structures, and machine learning algorithms. Each visualization includes real-time complexity analysis and interactive controls.
problem: Learning algorithms from textbooks provides static examples without seeing how data structures evolve during execution.
solution: Created an interactive platform that visualizes algorithm execution step-by-step with animations, allowing users to control speed, pause, and see complexity metrics in real-time.
architecture: React + TypeScript front end with Vite; modular algorithm implementations; custom hooks for state management; Tailwind CSS for responsive UI; category-based routing system.
challenges: Coordinating animations across different algorithm types; managing complex state for visualizations; ensuring smooth performance during animations; creating intuitive controls for diverse algorithm families.
results: Educational tool that makes abstract algorithms tangible; users can understand algorithm behavior visually; complexity metrics help with analysis; platform supports adding new algorithms easily.
